Protected Member Functions

 Point (const Record &r)
 Basic copy constructor.

Detailed Description

Point Definition.



Note: Any changes made to this record will not be reflected in the packet. This maintains the CONOP that anything read from the packet can be used independent of the packet and that the packet can only be modified by calling a set method on the packet its self.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

vrt::Point::Point ( const Record &  r  )  [protected]

Basic copy constructor.

vrt::Point::Point (  ) 

Creates a new instance ready for the fields to be set.

All of the bytes that make up the record will be initialized to 0.

virtual string vrt::Point::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::Record.

virtual ValueType vrt::Point::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.
